page.title: 05Buying a House (continued)
page.content: The steps to buying a house are:first you choose a house you want to buy then go to a Building Society or Bank to ask for a mortgage and then to a solicitor to ask ask him to begin preparations on the legal work involved. If the "chain" of people buying and selling their houses is a long one then there can be many problems along the way to signing the final contract which will mean the house you want is yours. Very few people are able to buy a home for cash and the majority will have to borrow the money on mortgage and gradually repay it perhaps over as many as twenty or twenty five years. Quite a few people in Immingham have bought their Council house. (Written and researched by Emma Houlton and Emma Dillerstone)
